intro: Isocoma gypsophilia, commonly known as desert gypsophila, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is adapted to arid environments, featuring silver-gray foliage and a compact growth habit. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with ray florets surrounding a central disk. Isocoma gypsophilia is often found in sandy or rocky soils, thriving in full sun conditions.
